DeregistrationReasonOtherText: OVER 50% IN VOLUME AND SALES TO RETAIL END USERS. EXEMPT FROM RMP.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at Delta Liquid Energy:  This facility complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Santa Maria Fire Depatrment and request that they respond to the emergency.  We also train employees to handle small emergencies.

A discription of our facility and the regulated substances handled:  This facility is a bulk terminal, storing LPG for resale to retail propane outlets and wholesale end users.  The facility consists of three 30,000-gal. bulk storage tanks, and one LPG rail car connected to the process at a time with a water capacity of up to 34,500-gal.                                                                          

The worst- case and alternative release scenarios: Our worst case scenario is the failure of one 34,500-gallon tank car when filled to the greatest amount allowed (88% @ 60F), resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The resulting distance to the end point extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.  Our alternative release scenario is a break in a 2-inch diameter pipe, leading to a 10-minute release and explosion.  The resulting distance extends offsite, and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint.                                                                                                                              

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:  This facility complies with EPA`s accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  The propane system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.                                                      

Five-year accident history:  We have never had an accident involving propane tha

t caused deaths, injuries, property or enviromental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.                                                                                                    

The emergency response program:  In the event of an emergency involving our propane system, it is our policy to notify the Santa Maria Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We also continue to train our employees to respond to, and handle small emergencies.  We have made our response plans available to the fire department; members of the fire department have inspected our facility and they have formulated their response plan.                                                  

Planned changes to improve safety:  None
